title: Buzz Prediction In Online Social Network
developer: F Kawala, A Douzal-Chouakria, E Gaussier
description: This dataset contains two different social networks: Twitter, a micro-blogging platform with exponential growth and extremely fast dynamics, and Tom's Hardware, a worldwide forum network focusing on new technology with more conservative dynamics but distinctive features.

title: Criteo Uplift Prediction Dataset
developer: Eustache Diemert, Artem Betlei, Christophe Renaudin, Massih-Reza Amini, Théophane Gregoir, Thibaud Rahier
description: A Large Scale Benchmark for Individual Treatment Effect Prediction and Uplift Modeling

title: NLP-based Test Selection Tool
developer: Bahareh Afshinpour, Roland Groz, Massih-Reza Amini, Yves Ledru, Catherine Oriat
description: This tool uses NLP (e.g., Word2Vec) to select a smaller, more efficient test suite while preserving fault detection capability, reducing testing time.

title: Bug Zone Finder
developer: Bahareh Afshinpour, Roland Groz, Massih-Reza Amini
description: This project identifies "Bug-Zone" areas in log files to help detect faults in resource-limited embedded systems that handle large network data but lack storage for debugging.

title: Self-Training of Halfspaces
developer: Lies Hadjadj, Massih-Reza Amini, Sana Louhichi
description: Generalization Guarantees of Self-Training of Halfspaces under Label Noise Corruption

title: Proper Topological Regions
developer: Lies Hadjadj, Emilie Devijver, Rémi Molinier, Massih-Reza Amini
description: Efficient Initial Data Selection and Labeling for Multi-Class Classification Using Topological Analysis

title: Trans-bounds Majority Vote
developer: Vasilii Feofanov, Emilie Devijver, Massih-Reza Amini
description: This semi-supervised framework iteratively assigns pseudo-labels to unlabeled data using a transductive bound. It builds on any probabilistic classifier; here, a random forest is used.

title: Comparable Corpora Generator
developer: Anna Laskina, Eric Gaussier, Gaelle Calvary
description: Creating Clustered Comparable Corpora from Wikipedia with Different Fuzziness Levels and Language Representativity

title: Comparable Clustering
developer: Anna Laskina, Eric Gaussier, Gaelle Calvary
description: A Closer Look at Clustering Bilingual Comparable Corpora

title: Deep k-Means
developer: Maziar Moradi Fard, Thibaut Thonet, Eric Gaussier
description: Deep k-Means: Jointly clustering with k-Means and learning representations

title: KeyBLD
description: KeyBLD: Selecting Key Blocks with Local Pre-ranking for Long Document Information Retrieval

title: Causal Discovery for Time Series
developer: Charles K. Assaad, Emilie Devijver, Eric Gaussier
description: Survey and Evaluation of Causal Discovery Methods for Time Series

title: PCGCE
developer: Charles K. Assaad, Emilie Devijver, Eric Gaussier
description: Causal Discovery of Extended Summary Graphs in Time Series

title: CMIh2022
developer: Lei Zan, Anouar Meynaoui, Charles K. Assaad, Emilie Devijver, Eric Gaussier
description: A Conditional Mutual Information Estimator for Mixed Data and an Associated Conditional Independence Test

title: T-RCA
developer: Lei Zan, Charles K. Assaad, Emilie Devijver, Eric Gaussier
description: On the Fly Detection of Root Causes from Observed Data with Application to IT Systems

title: TSLA-FSGA
developer: Vasilii Feofanov, Emilie Devijver, Massih-Reza Amini
description: Wrapper feature selection with partially labeled data

title: hdmax2
developer: Florence Pittion, Magali Richard, Olivier Francois, Basile Jumentier
description: The R package hdmax2 offers powerful tools for conducting high-dimensional mediation analysis. This method investigates the causal pathways linking exposure variables to outcome variables through intermediary factors known as mediators. These mediators often stem from biological metrics like transcriptomes or methylomes, which present data in high dimensions.

title: penda
developer: Clémentine Decamps, Florent Chuffart, Magali Richard
description: An R package that performs personalized differential analysis of omics data. The penda package provide different methods to perform differential analysis.

title: decomics
description: DECOMICS is an R-shiny web application that can be launched (i) directly from a local R session using the R package available here on gitlab (either by installing it locally or via a virtual machine and a Docker image that we provide); or (ii) in the Biosphere—IFB Clouds Federation for Life Science, a multi-cloud environment scalable for high-performance computing.
